meanings.definition: The act of paying for something
meanings.sent1: The defrayal of the meal was split between friends.
meanings.sent2: The defrayal of the rent was due at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The defrayal of the parking ticket brought a smile to his face.
meanings.sent4: Her defrayal of the debt lifted a weight off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The defrayal of the bill was swift and painless.

meanings.definition: The covering of costs or expenses
meanings.sent1: The company's defrayal of travel expenses was generous.
meanings.sent2: The defrayal of the project's budget was carefully planned.
meanings.sent3: His defrayal of the shopping spree left him feeling satisfied.
meanings.sent4: The defrayal of the medical bills was a relief for the family.
meanings.sent5: The defrayal of the repair costs saved the day.
